name: gravel/sand quarry construction | gravel/sand quarry infrastructure | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9618/documentation

This dataset represents the construction of 1 gravel and sand mine infrastructure. Data was based on an evaluation of an operating plant with an excavated amount of about 400'000 to 500'000 t/a and the life time is assumed to be 50 years. Data was estimated based on an air-picture and sketches of the process. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From unoccupied land foreseen for a gravel and sand mine.

This activity ends with the constructed buildings and machineries for a gravel and sand mine. This dataset doesn't include the land-use of the mining activities (quarrying).
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Resource Extraction; Minerals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data was obtained from Swiss industries.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data of the infrastructure corresponds to the current level of technology.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Measured data of four Swiss plants

exchanges.description: This dataset is applied to a plant with a total produced amount per unit (50 years) of 30,000,000,000 kg (year 1997).

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on literature values. The total land occupation considered was 14.675 m2 and a time occupation of 50 years was assumed.

Estimation, based on an air-picture and sketch process. The required amount of infraestructure referring to the machines is based on the assumption that the total mass of all machines used for the production (1 sieve (5t), 20 'small' silos (each 7t), diverse machine (25t)) come to 170 tons. The service life is assumed to be about 25 years.
